ultrayolo.datasets.common.load_classes(path, as_dict=False)[source]¶
it expect to read a file with one class per line sorted in the same order with respect
to the class name. example: dog cat will be codified as dog -> 0 cat -> 1 …. -> 2 The index 0 is used to represent no class
Parameters:{str} -- the path where the file is saved (path) –
Keyword Arguments:
 {bool} -- load the classes as dictionary (as_dict) – {False})
Returns:list|dict – the list of the classes

ultrayolo.datasets.common.prepare_batch(batch_images, batch_boxes, batch_classes, target_shape, max_objects, augmenters=None, pad=True)[source]¶
prepare a batch of images and boxes:
  • resize all the images to the same size
  • update the size of the boxes basing on the new image size
Parameters:
  • {numpy.ndarry} -- an array of images with shape (batch_images) –
  • {np.ndarray} -- (batch_boxes) – an array of array with format (xmin, ymin, xmax, ymax)
  • {tuple} -- a shape of type (target_shape) –
  • {int} -- the maximum number of boxes to track (max_objects) –
Keyword Arguments:
 
  • {imgaug.augmenters} -- ImgAug augmenters (default (augmenters) – {None})
  • {bool} -- if the images should be padded (default (pad) – {True})
Returns:

[type] – [description]
ultrayolo.datasets.common.resize(image, target_shape, boxes=None, keep_aspect_ratio=True)[source]¶

Resize images and boxes to the target shape :param image: :type image: an image with shape (H,W,C) :param target_shape: :type target_shape: a shape of type (H,W,C) :param boxes: :type boxes: an array of format (xmin, ymin, xmax, ymax) :param keep_aspect_ratio: :type keep_aspect_ratio: (default: True)

Returns:
  • image_resized (the image resized)
  • boxes_resized (the boxes resized (optional: if boxes is not None))
